form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Coburn (for himself, Mr. Thune, Mr. Paul, Mr. Johnson of Wisconsin, Mr. Inhofe, Mr. Boozman, Mr. Grassley, Mr. Risch, Mr. Wicker, Mr. Vitter, and Mr. Roberts) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To amend title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to ensure that the coverage offered under multi-State qualified health plans offered in Exchanges is consistent with the Federal abortion funding ban.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the Preventing the Offering of Elective Coverage of Taxpayer-Funded-Abortion Act of 2013
or the PROTECT Act .

section.header: Consistency with Federal abortion funding ban for coverage under multi-State plans in exchanges

subsection.text: Paragraph (6) of section 1334(a) of the Patient protection and Affordable Care Act (42 U.S.C. 18054(a)(6)) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.header: Consistency with federal abortion funding ban

subparagraph.text: In entering into contracts under this subsection, the Director shall ensure that no multi-State qualified health plan offered in an Exchange provides for coverage of abortions.

The limitation established in
subparagraph (A) shall not apply to an abortion—

clause.text: if the pregnancy is the result of an act of rape or incest; or

in a case where a woman suffers from a physical disorder, physical injury, or physical illness that would, as certified by a physician, place the woman in danger of death unless an abortion is performed, including a life-endangering physical condition caused by or arising from the pregnancy itself.

subsection.text: Section 1303(c) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (42 U.S.C. 18023(c)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking Nothing in this Act and inserting Subject to paragraph (4), nothing in this Act; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Application of limitation for multi-state plans
paragraph.text: Paragraph (6) of section 1334(a) shall preempt any State law requiring coverage of or funding for abortions with respect to the application of such law to multi-State qualified health plans.
